author: James Whaling
title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds target Emil Forsberg signs new deal with Leipzig
text:
Forsberg is having a fine season with Leipzig (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Liverpool   
Liverpool target Emil Forsberg has signed a new deal with RB Leipzig. 
The Swedish international has attracted interest from Liverpool, with Jurgen Klopp said to be readying a £20m bid in the summer. 
Juventus were also keen but Leipzig have tied down the player. 
Forsberg has signed a new deal until 2022. Klopp urges Reds to win EVERY game Klopp during his press conference (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp has set his side the target of winning their last 14 matches, reports David Maddock in the Mirror. 
Liverpool entertain Spurs on Saturday evening and for Klopp, that means winning their last 14 Premier League games - or at least aiming to - and he argued that is is perfectly possible, because he knows exactly what it takes to go on such an amazing run. 
"I don’t have to think that it is possible, it is possible," he explained. "That is how football is. It is not that I get up in the morning and think, ‘Oh my god, we have already won them’, but I know that it is possible. 
"That keeps me up. As long as we can go for all." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
